quest.name: Rise of the Machinists
journal: Stephanivien has received word on the upcoming trial.

With the day of the trial near at hand, Stephanivien would host a feast in honor of his machinists' accomplishments. As has become customary, however, the principal players are nowhere to be found. Head out into Foundation, and locate Rostnsthal, Joye, Celestaux, and Count Baurendouin de Haillenarte.

You have found and spoken with Stephanivien's absent guests. The count, though he wishes his son well, has declined to attend. Return to the Skysteel Manufactory, and pass on his message to Stephanivien.

Stephanivien thanks you for summoning everyone to the feast, and speaks highly of your positive influence on the manufactory. It is time now, he vows, for the machinists to make their mark on history. Prepare yourself for a demanding battle, and join Stephanivien at Twinpools in the Coerthas western highlands.

In an unexpected turn of events, the machinists find themselves defending Tedalgrinche as they fight to defeat Veri Selen and its host of lesser minions. Upon the great beast's demise, the grateful noble at last recognizes machinistry's worth, and promises to work alongside the manufactory chief in building a place for the machinists in Ishgard. Return to the Skysteel Manufactory, and share this triumph with Stephanivien.

Stephanivien reflects on the events of the battle, and rejoices that the age of machinistry has at last arrived in Ishgard. With Rostnsthal's departure, however, he recognizes that there remain none in the workshop who can match your skill with a firearm. Take the lessons you have learned in the manufactory, and do your part in spreading the machinist trade to the farthest reaches of Eorzea!

※The next machinist quest will be available from Stephanivien once you have met the following requirements:
※ FINAL FANTASY XIV: Stormblood must be registered to your service account.
※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “The Far Edge of Fate.”
objectives: Speak with Count Baurendouin de Haillenarte.
Speak with Stephanivien at the Skysteel Manufactory.
Protect Tedalgrinche and defeat the dragons!

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: A day has been chosen for our trial against Veri Selen. More than any that have come before, this battle shall be pivotal in deciding the future of the manufactory and machinistry both. Thus, ere we march forth to meet our fate, I would hold a celebration in honor of all that we have accomplished.

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: As has become customary, however, the principal players are nowhere to be found. Pray head out into the city, and seek out Joye, Rostnsthal, Celestaux...and my father.

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: Pray head out into the city, and seek out Joye, Rostnsthal, Celestaux...and my father.

dialogue.name: ROSTNSTHAL
dialogue.text: What? Another bleedin' celebration? Well, I guess we never did get to 'ave that first one.

dialogue.name: ROSTNSTHAL
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename─I knew the first time I met ye ye'd be a demon with a carbine. An' bugger me if I weren't right.

dialogue.name: ROSTNSTHAL
dialogue.text: Now look at us: ready to stand side by side against one o' the biggest bloody dragons to ever raid a supply train. I'll get everyone through this, though, don't ye worry...

dialogue.name: JOYE
dialogue.text: Aye, I'll head there right now. But afore we do, Forename...

dialogue.name: JOYE
dialogue.text: I wanted to thank you again for helpin' me find me way. I just got meself back to where I belong, and I ain't about to give up the workshop a second time!

dialogue.name: CELESTAUX
dialogue.text: A feast, is it? I can already feel me belly rumblin'...

dialogue.name: CELESTAUX
dialogue.text: As always, the chief works to make the manufactory a place where commoners like me feel welcome. He's done his best for us, and I mean to do me best for him...even if it means fightin' that monster of a dragon.

dialogue.name: BAURENDOUIN
dialogue.text: I am invited to the manufactory? Well, well, how times have changed. Though I appreciate the gesture, I do not have a place at that table. I vowed to leave Skysteel matters to Stephanivien alone, and so I shall.

dialogue.name: BAURENDOUIN
dialogue.text: Tell my son that I shall pray for victory, and the prosperous future that will grow from his success.

dialogue.name: ROSTNSTHAL
dialogue.text: Been a good while since I shared a drink with mates. Reminds me of old times...an' mistakes I don't mean to repeat.

dialogue.name: JOYE
dialogue.text: Forename, you should have a nibble─it's all so delicious, I might gobble the lot meself! His lordship says this feast is courtesy of the count...

dialogue.name: CELESTAUX
dialogue.text: Ah, I ain't eaten like this since...well, ever, to be honest. If this's to be me last meal, then I'll die a happy man...

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: Thank you for summoning everyone to the feast. And thank you for Father's message.

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: Eat, drink, and be merry, my friends! Soon, we shall introduce Veri Selen to the rage of the machinists...for the manufactory, and for Ishgard!

dialogue.name: ROSTNSTHAL
dialogue.text: (-Machinists-)For Ishgard!

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: See how their eyes shine with determination? You were the perfect choice to act as my ambassador.

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: Ever has your presence been a boon to the manufactory. I often wonder what would have become of us had you not chosen to walk the path of the machinist...

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text:
Though our next battle together will indeed be perilous, it shall also serve to demonstrate the pinnacle of our achievements. When Veri Selen lies defeated in the snow, we will have accomplished a deed that Tedalgrinche─and the Holy See─believe nigh impossible.
When you are ready to make history, join us at the site of the trial in the Coerthas western highlands.

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: When you are ready to make history, join us at the site of the trial in the Coerthas western highlands.

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: Lord Tedalgrinche, my machinists are assembled. We now but await the arrival of the dreaded Veri Selen.

dialogue.name: TEDALGRINCHE
dialogue.text: Excellent! I am accompanied by a priest of the Holy See, who shall ensure that the trial proceeds in accordance with Ishgardian law. A wagon has also been provided to tempt the talons of your quarry.

dialogue.name: TEDALGRINCHE
dialogue.text: The Observatorium has been tracking the creature's movements... According to their calculations, Veri Selen and its entourage should fly over this pass within the hour.

dialogue.name: OBSERVER01712
dialogue.text: (-Ishgardian Priest-)Should the machinists of the Skysteel Manufactory satisfy the conditions of this trial by combat─either through victory or valorous death─then shall your innocence be proven and your honor redeemed. Should you choose to flee, however... I trust I need not elaborate further?

dialogue.name: OBSERVER01712
dialogue.text: (-Ishgardian Priest-)We shall oversee proceedings from on high, that I might judge thine actions evenly and with uninterrupted view. May justice be served.

dialogue.name: TEDALGRINCHE
dialogue.text: Ahahaha! Your Reverence, pray do not avert your eyes should the scene become one of bloody carnage. We would not wish to deny these fine combatants a fair trial.

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: My strategy for the battle is thus: hit these beasts with everything we have! Deploy every turret and shoot every bullet! We shall bury Veri Selen under a hail of metal and fire!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: No... This was me chance to make it right...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Fight on, my friends...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Load! Aim...? Why's it gone all dark...?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I'm done for...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I knew I could not depend on you machinists...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: For the manufactory, and for Ishgard!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I wonder who shall scream the loudest...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Forename, pray aid Celestaux!
His position is overrun!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
There's just too many of 'em!
We're gonna need help over here!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Veri Selen commands an impressive number of minions...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Celestaux! See to Tedalgrinche!
Forename! We shall engage Veri Selen!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Aye, I'll see the noble lord ain't killed!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: 'Tis not quite the scene I envisioned...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
And still they come...
Quickly, Forename! To Tedalgrinche's side!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Dammit! We can't hold 'em all!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Hmph. Will you prove me right, machinists?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Ware, Forename!
Our foe has become desperate!

dialogue.name: ROSTNSTHAL
dialogue.text: Bloody 'ells, it's massive... An' that's the thing we gotta kill?

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: As manufactory chief, I have but one order for you all: survive the battle!

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: Machinists! Protect the fallen!

dialogue.name: TEDALGRINCHE
dialogue.text: ...Why do this? Why protect me? Should you but allow the dragons to do their bloody work, you will be free to pursue your agenda...

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: Aye, and few could argue that you had earned it. After the grief you have caused, I should take what is left of your corpse and string it up for target practice!

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: But if my machinists are truly to be the spear and shield of Ishgard, we must defend all her citizens with equal zeal!

dialogue.name: TEDALGRINCHE
dialogue.text: I fear that excessive association with commoners has softened your brain... The oath you have sworn, however, is indeed a knightly one.

dialogue.name: JOYE
dialogue.text: If you're done yappin', Lord Tedalgrinche, we're a bit bloody busy here! Wag that tongue again and it'll be the first thing I put a bullet through!

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: You'd best heed her warning, old fellow. Joye is not one to give voice to idle threats.

dialogue.name: TEDALGRINCHE
dialogue.text: Until this day, I have but observed your battles from afar. What a perfect opportunity for me to evaluate your skills from a more...intimate perspective.

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: By the Fury, is he still speaking!? Leave him, Joye─we have more pressing matters to attend to! Let us shoot a path through the foes arrayed before us!

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: We've done it! The damnable beast is dead!

dialogue.name: TEDALGRINCHE
dialogue.text: ...I thank you for saving my life. The accusations against you shall, of course, be withdrawn.

dialogue.name: TEDALGRINCHE
dialogue.text: As a further token of my gratitude, I would offer you a boon. Speak your wish, and I shall do all within my power to grant it.

dialogue.name: ROSTNSTHAL
dialogue.text: A “boon”!? Ye think one little favor'll wipe the ledger clean o' yer steamin' shite!?

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: Fortunately, my heart has but one desire... I will have your oath that henceforth you shall no longer oppose the rise of the machinists, and never again seek to interfere in the operation of the Skysteel Manufactory.

dialogue.name: TEDALGRINCHE
dialogue.text: ...Is that all? No chests of coin? No promises of power? The workings of your mind are truly an enigma to me.

dialogue.name: TEDALGRINCHE
dialogue.text: But you shall have my word on this, nevertheless. Indeed, we shall discover the best means by which your fine machinists might contribute to Ishgard's defenses.

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: 'Tis only from behind a sturdy front line that a machinist's full potential is realized. Together with your knights, however, we will change the face of war.

dialogue.name: TEDALGRINCHE
dialogue.text: Ahahaha! Of course! You cannot yet do without the masters of the battlefield! May we strike fear into the hearts of our enemies, and ensure the continued prosperity of the Holy See! Fare you well, Lord Stephanivien.

dialogue.name: ROSTNSTHAL
dialogue.text: ...Well, that's that, then. Thanks for lettin' me join ye on this one, boss. I think I'm ready to move on now...

dialogue.name: ROSTNSTHAL
dialogue.text: Joye. Yer aim's as sharp as yer 'arpy tongue. Good work, lass. I nominate ye to take over as master o' marksmanship.

dialogue.name: ROSTNSTHAL
dialogue.text: Forename. Yer too bleedin' quiet, but yer weapon speaks loud enough, I s'pose. Keep firin' like ye do, an' I reckon new students'll flock to the workshop to follow in yer footsteps.

dialogue.name: JOYE
dialogue.text: Are you truly leavin' us...?

dialogue.name: ROSTNSTHAL
dialogue.text: I've never been the kind o' bloke as sticks in one place for too long. Ye've treated me well at the workshop─better'n I deserve, I reckon─but it's time I weighed anchor. I'll be seein' ye, then.

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: Should your travels bring you back to Ishgard, know you always have a place at the manufactory, my friend! Shall we be on our way, as well?

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: What an extraordinary turn of events. With these troubles behind us, however, I feel the age of machinistry has finally arrived.

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: And you, Forename, have all but outgrown the manufactory─with Rostnsthal's departure, there are none who might compete with your skill at firearms. Pray take the lessons you have learned, and make known the machinist's trade in every corner of Eorzea.

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: You are, of course, welcome to return to us whenever you desire. We shall be here, ever serving Ishgard as her deadliest spear and sturdiest shield.

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
dialogue.text: Ah, before I forget, Rostnsthal asked that I encourage you to push the limits of your marksmanship. I believe his exact words were, “so that ye can blast through any pile of shite what might stand in yer way!” I'm getting better at the accent, don't you think?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This concludes the machinist quests for FINAL FANTASY XIV: Heavensward. In order to undertake the next series of quests, you must first meet the following requirements:

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text:
※ FINAL FANTASY XIV: Stormblood must be registered to your service account.
※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “The Far Edge of Fate.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have done so, the next machinist quest will be available from Stephanivien.

dialogue.name: STEPHANIVIEN
